result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Corey William Hanson was found guilty of OWI (6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham March 2, 2016 - Amend JOC to reflect pre-sentence credit.

-Concurrent to any other sentence.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: $4000.00 fine to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF154.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF154.
$85.50 Blood Draw to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF154.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Mental Health Evaluation and follow recommendations.
-To complete MRT.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Minot. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Corey William Hanson appeared from jail. Case called at 3:04 pm. Court reviews file and PSI. ADA Hartung makes recommendations. Atty Stormont responds. Defendant make statement. Court orders: 
1.5 yr i/c, 3 yrs e/s with conditions
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and regular testing
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- AODA follow recommendations
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow recommendations
- To complete MRT
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- F/F $4,000 plus costs
- 85.50 for blood draw
- 3 year revocation of Drivers License and 3 year IID
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program and not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Concurrent to any other sentence
Bond revoked and Defendant remanded to St. Croix County Sheriff's Dept

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Alex Stormont DF: Corey William Hanson appeared from jail. Case called at 4:05. ADA Hartung makes recommendations. Atty. Stormont agrees. Court orders a PSI. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 15CF154 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. DE acknowledges priors. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 6th offense in 15CF154. On motion of the State without objection, Crt merge and dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF154. Court revokes bail and remands DE to jail pending sentencing. PSI to be completed by 09-22-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed by ADA Matthew Hartung. eif
Plea hearing at 07-22-2015 03:45 pm

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for PBT testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.
